Dreadplague shrieked and lunged forward.

Dreadplague: Follow us, Synergy. You shall meet the Major soon.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> wrote:
> : : Darkangel : :
> Darkangel jumps up into the air, transforming to his bat mode.
> 
> Darkangel: Beast mode! Let's go.
> 
> He heads for the Tripredacus base.
> 
> 
> Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:Dreadplague: Then let's go. Angel?
> 
> She transformed to wyvern mode and took altitude, waiting for the two
> others.
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "cardhead649" <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > "I have a rocket mode, don't I?" Synergy replies in an 'is-water-
> > wet?' tone.  She transforms to the flying craft she'd first appeared 
> > as.
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic" <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> > > Dreadplague: Yes, that's right. Can you fly?
> > > 
> > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "cardhead649" <cardhead649@y...> 
> > wrote:
> > > > "Right.  Whatever.  Now, am I going to meet the Major, or are we 
> > just 
> > > > going to stand around here and blabber?"  Synergy clearly has no 
> > > > interest in the second option.
> > > > 
> > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic" <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> > > > > Dreadplague grinned a bit before answering. If she wanted to 
> > become
> > > > > agressive, she would gladly make her submit. But not for now.
> > > > > 
> > > > > Dreadplague: Many reasons. First, they fight against each 
> > other, so
> > > > > why not let them tear themselves apart? Second, I have heard 
> > that 
> > > > the
> > > > > Cosmic Rust is around. It's no good conquering if you die from 
> > it, 
> > > > no?
> > > > > 
> > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "cardhead649" <cardhead649@y...> 
> > > > wrote:
> > > > > > "My point is specialization!" Synergy jabs Dreaplague hard in 
> > the 
> > > > > > chest with her cannon arm to emphasize herself.  And a 
> > particle 
> > > > beam 
> > > > > > cannon pointed at your vital regions is a lot of 
> > > > emphasis.  "There's 
> > > > > > a difference between breaking up barfights and fighting a 
> > war.  
> > > > > > Anyway, if they're really that weak, why haven't you wiped 
> > them 
> > > > out 
> > > > > > already, hmmm?"
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic" <Proudwing500k@h...> 
> > wrote:
> > > > > > > Dreadplague frowns at her.
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > Dreadplague: Your point being? We're fighting Maxies and 
> > Preds. 
> > > > We
> > > > > > > conquered their homeworld. The ones we have here aren't 
> > that 
> > > > bad.
>
